articleContent.title: Chord: Diminished 7th in F# (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Diminished 7th in F# (Shape: G)

## Description:
The Diminished 7th chord in F# (also known as F#dim7 or F#°7) consists of the notes F#, A, C, and E♭. This chord is enharmonically the same as Gdim7, as the notes F#, A, C, and E♭ represent the same pitches as G, B♭, C#, and E. In practical application, it is often notated as Gdim7 for easier reading.

## Notes and Intervals:
- F# (1)
- A (♭3)
- C (♭5)
- E♭ (♭♭7 or ♭6)

## Musical Flavor and Genre:
The Diminished 7th chord in F# creates a tense and dissonant sound due to the minor 3rd (A), diminished 5th (C), and diminished 7th (E♭) intervals within the chord. It is commonly used to create tension and lead to a resolution in jazz, classical, and even some modern pop music. Due to its unstable nature, it often serves as a passing chord in progressions.

## Example Songs:
1. "All the Things You Are" by Jerome Kern
2. "I'll Remember April" by Gene de Paul
3. "Stella By Starlight" by Victor Young
